Chapter XXVIII. - The Skin and its Functions.

                 Physiology of the Skin. 
Elimination. 
     791. Impurities are constantly and imperceptibly passing from the body, through the pores, and if the surface of the skin is not kept in a healthy condition, the system is burdened with impure matter.--H. to L., Chap. 4, p. 60.
